intro: Temnocalyx verdickii, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a climbing shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in forested areas. Due to its nocturnal blooming habit, it is also known for its unique pollination by moths and other night-active insects.
